entry.et: Middle English lenen, lenden, from Old English lǣnan, from lǣn loan loan

def.dt: :to give for temporary use on condition that the same or its equivalent be returned lend me your pen
:to put at another's temporary disposal lent us their services
:to let out (money) for temporary use on condition of repayment with interest
:to give the assistance or support of :afford furnish a dispassionate and scholarly manner which lends great force to his criticisms Times Literary Supplement
:to adapt or apply (oneself) readily :accommodate a topic that lends itself admirably to class discussion

:the transfer of goods and services to an ally to aid in a common cause with payment made by a return of the original items or their use in the cause or by a similar transfer of other goods and services
